page.title: 12SKIVO FARM NEAR LIVINGSTON
page.content: In our area is{Skivo Farm}which we passed on our walk along the{Murieston {Trail.}The owner supplied us with imformation. Skivo Farm has been there since{1588 or maybe earlier.{Mid Calder Parish {Church}has a record about a man called John Anderson at the above date. The present owners have been there for 7 years and bought the farm from Miss and Mr Morley. Five or six people work on the Farm, four of which are family. They keep horses,dogs,cats,rabbit and 1 duck on 36 acres of land.Most of the horses were bought at private sales expept one which was bought from a horse dealer. Each horse costs around Â£400.It costs about Â£250 to run the farm per week.Workers are paid Â£50 plus full board.
